intro: Boechera constancei, commonly known as the Constance's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Boechera constancei is often found in mountainous regions and is considered a rare or endemic species in some areas.
